author: Hannah Graham
title: Another North East MP has joined the revolt against Jeremy Corbyn
text:
Another North East MP has joined the revolt against Jeremy Corbyn 20:46, 27 Jun 2016 Sunderland MP Sharon Hodgson has resigned condemning Corbyn's 'lacklustre" EU campaign Shares Get daily news by email 2011 Getty Images Sharon Hodgson 
Washington and Sunderland West MP Sharon Hodgson has joined the rebellion against Jeremy Corbyn. 
She resigned her post as Shadow Minister for Children and Families on Monday, condemning Mr Corbyn’s campaign against Brexit as “lacklustre” and saying he could not command the support of the wider parliamentary Labour Party. 
Announcing her decision on Twitter, the former Shadow Minister said she felt “great regret”. 
In her resignation letter, she said that, although she had not supported Mr Corbyn ’s leadership campaign, she had welcomed the opportunity to serve on the front bench and had not taken the decision to stand down lightly. 
But she said: “Now, more than ever, we need a united and effective opposition... and I am not confident that you can give us that leadership.” Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn leaves his home in north London 
She added: “This is even more concerning now that the extent of your ambivalence and lacklustre campaigning to remain in the EU has come to light.” 
Expressing her concern that a snap election could approaching, she said that if the party were to face election under its current leadership it might be “fighting for its very existence” 
She added: “I am concerned that this will leave the people we both came into politics to help and serve in a far worse position, abandoned for a generation.” 
Ms Hodgson called on Mr Corbyn to do “the honourable, decent and selfless thing” in stepping down. 
“I want you to be remembered as the Labour Leader who reinvigorated our membership,” she told him, “not the Labour Leader who irreparably broke the Party we both hold so dear.” 
While 46 shadow front bench members, including Durham’s Roberta Blackman-Woods, have now stepped down, the resulting reshuffle has lead to top jobs for others from the region. Ian Forsyth/Getty Images Pat Glass MP 
Pat Glass, the Labour MP for North West Durham, becomes the new Shadow Education Secretary. She had been the Shadow Europe Minister. 
Easington MP Grahame Morris becomes Shadow Secretary of State for Communities and Local Government and Shadow Minister for the Constitutional Convention. 
Dave Anderson , Labour MP for Blaydon, is the new Shadow Northern Ireland Secretary. He was previously a party whip. 
And Andy McDonald, Labour MP for Middlesbrough, is promoted from his role as a shadow transport minister to become the new Shadow Transport Secretary. 
The Parliamentary Labour Party is set to go ahead with a no-confidence vote against Mr Corbyn’s aides insisted the leader would not quit. 
He has previously said he would stand again for election, if forced to step down, pointing to the large mandate he holds from grassroots labour members.
